com.philips.platform.appinfra.securestorage

Interface SecureStorageInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SecureStorage, SecureStorageV1, SecureStorageV2

    public interface SecureStorageInterface
extends java.io.Serializable
    The interface Secure storage interface.

                         java.lang.String valueToBeEncrypted,
                         SecureStorageInterface.SecureStorageError secureStorageError)
        Store value for key .
        Parameters:
        userKey - the user key
        valueToBeEncrypted - the value to be encrypted
        secureStorageError - the secure storage error
        Returns:
        denote store operation success or failure
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • storeValueForKey

        boolean storeValueForKey(java.lang.String userKey,
                         byte[] valueToBeEncrypted,
                         SecureStorageInterface.SecureStorageError secureStorageError)
        Store value for key. Use this API when you would like to save byte[] in secure storage.
        Parameters:
        userKey - the user key
        valueToBeEncrypted - the value to be encrypted
        secureStorageError - the secure storage error
        Returns:
        denote store operation success or failure
        Since:
        1803.0

                                  SecureStorageInterface.SecureStorageError secureStorageError)

        Parameters:
        userKey - the user key
        secureStorageError - the secure storage error code if any
        Returns:
        the string, decrypted value
        Since:
        1.0.0

                  SecureStorageInterface.SecureStorageError error)

        error - the secure storage error
        Returns:
        denote store operation success or failure
        Since:
        1.2.1

      • doesStorageKeyExist

        boolean doesStorageKeyExist(java.lang.String key)
        Retruns true if passed user key is already present in Secure storage. If you want to save a data for a key its better to check if key is already present otherwise it will override already present data for that key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        Since:
        1802.0

      • doesEncryptionKeyExist

        boolean doesEncryptionKeyExist(java.lang.String key)
        After creating encryption key using createKey you can check whether key is already present for passed key using this method.
        Parameters:
        key - user key
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        1802.0

      • getKey

        java.security.Key getKey(java.lang.String keyName,
                         SecureStorageInterface.SecureStorageError error)
        Retrieve value for Create Key .
        Parameters:
        keyName - the user key to access the password
        error - the secure storage error code if any
        Returns:
        the string, decrypted value
        Since:
        1.2.1
